EDIT:

My apologies. When I posted the cards up here, I'd thought I'd just look up the prices, and trade or sell them. My main expertise isn't in the t206 (in fact, I'm a beginner at best). I've acquired these in a big trade lot, and I haven't really paid attention to them in awhile.

I am having a real hard time coming up with the prices for some of these (most of these - especially the hindus), because I just don't see any prior sales. And ones I do are so long ago that I kind of don't know how to price them. If someone could help with them, I would appreciate it.


going to put up pics one by one as I figure them out:

Cy Young Old Mill - I'll price it at $600 (I actually dont know if that's crazy or not)

[IMG]https://s28.postimg.org/4efu4tvvh/cy2_2.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]https://s29.postimg.org/gmb19cwvb/cy2_1.jpg[/IMG]

Dave

me to :)

Cheers, Mike

Try Scot Reader's Price Check tool. It's taylor made for your needs, and would give you some good starting points.

[URL="http://www.t206insider.com/store/c1/insider#price-check/"]http://www.t206insider.com/store/c1/insider#price-check/[/URL]
So who bought the Lumley and for what price? I guess my communication wasnt sufficient
I'm confused did someone buy the whole lot? I was waiting on scan and prices still for the cards I inquired about

I briefly spoke with the seller in regards to the cards and such. He said he was overloaded with 60 PMs, so I can see how that could be a lot to handle. He also mentioned his relative newness to T206s, so he may have just elected to keep the cards. I hope he pipes in with something soon :)

In the meantime, I spoke with him about a post he made a few months back on Blowout Forums. I remember when he made that post--he added photos of his card display. Pretty dang cool :)

Cheers,
NJ

Attached: I located the photos from David's original Blowout post.

So the guy makes a trade involving thousands of dollars worth of cards, but somehow still has no idea how much they are worth? Post them on here without any details and is somehow surprised when people are interested in them? Doesn't even have the courtesy to reply to people's inquires? Then just post a nice "sold" without any explanation.  Real classy.

[quote name="Bruinsfan94" post=1626583]So the guy makes a trade involving thousands of dollars worth of cards, but somehow still has no idea how much they are worth? Post them on here without any details and is somehow surprised when people are interested in them? Doesn't even have the courtesy to reply to people's inquires? Then just post a nice "sold" without any explanation.  Real classy.[/QUOTE]



Agreed.  


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Appreciate your getting back to me.  Common courtesy might be to respond to people sending you emails and pm's or at a minimum to post a bit of an explanation as to how the cards were sold.  Thanks again.

[quote name="iwantitiwinit" post=1626858]Appreciate your getting back to me.  Common courtesy might be to respond to people sending you emails and pm's or at a minimum to post a bit of an explanation as to how the cards were sold.  Thanks again.[/QUOTE]


Well, at least I got one poorly thought out reply. I PM asking for scans & prices for 2 cards - he replys back to make him an offer (no scans or prices were included in his "reply"). I send another PM stating I will talk price once I see condition, then, magically, no reply....Hmmmm. I would suggest knowing the value of something before you try to sell it so you don't get fleeced or PO your target audience, dude....
I didn't get a reply at all... why bother posting something for sale if you won't respond? :confused:

No reply/scans... Now their all gone...
Bummer.
